resources.string: This will open a web page and consume mobile data
No apps can perform this action
To show a floating window, grant the app \"Floating Window\" permission
Click here to pick a timer
The timer with its records and schedulers will be permanently deleted
A convenient reminding step. It remembers your edit
It has its name and loop and can contain steps
Run a step once at the start of the whole task to prepare yourself
There is already a start step
Run a step once at the end of the whole task to wind up
There is already an end step
The duration should be at least 1 second
Timer name should not be empty
The loop should be a positive number
There should be at least one step
Show remaining time in the notification
Unable to move the start step
Unable to move the end step
If you would like to pick music without granting permission, or the default ringtone picker doesn\'t show your music, enabling this option might help.
Vibrate the phone at this step
0 for keeping vibrating until the end of the step.
The count should be between 0 and 100.
Wake up the phone and show a reminding screen
Stay at the step until you move on manually, and make it forward-timing
* If the field is empty, step name will be spoken.
* Click the \"Variables\" button at the bottom to pick variables. They will be replaced with the corresponding value when running.
* Variables whose description starts with \"(Group)\" means when the step is in a group, the value is calculated based on the group instead of the timer.
* Variables will be replaced with the corresponding value when running.
* Tap variables to insert them into the text box. Long press to check its usage.
* Enter the times after which the beep should stop.\n* 0 for keeping beeping until the end of the step.
Read \"Half of the time\" when this step is over halfway
Count down the last several seconds
* Enter the number of countdown seconds at the end of the step
Show another notification at the start of a step
* Enter the number of seconds after which the notification will be dismissed automatically.\n* 0 for not dismissing automatically.
Turn the flashlight on and off
Unable to start a timer in the trash
Just click around to see what can be customized
Shows the info of an ongoing timer and its actions
Like errors, billing issues, account issues, etc
Please use scheduler at your own risk
Scheduling work on Android is tricky. There are chances that the system does not trigger a scheduler. Please test on your own before relying on schedulers.
This value should be between 1 and 127

resources.string: Show the total time of the timer and groups
When counting down from 20 to 0, play recorded sound instead of synthesizing the speech from text.\n\nThis is faster and more consistent.
TimeR Machine, a great interval/workouts timer app
Welcome!\nClick the Right Arrow below to start the tutorial.
Let\'s create an exercise plan where we run for 3 minutes, then walk 2 minutes, and loop the process 5 times.
Click ➕ to create a new timer.
A card represents a step of the plan.
Click the time by the side of the step name and change the time to 3 minutes.
In this app, you must add reminders after a step, or the app won\'t remind you.
Click Notifier button to add a step to remind you after the run.
Click ➕ below the step duration to add reminders. Let\'s add Music and Vibration.
You can long-press a reminder to check its usage, on added reminders, or when selecting.
Add a Normal step for walking.
Set the walk time to 2 minutes.
Add another notifier to get reminded after the walk.
Setup is done! Let\'s click ✔ at the top of the screen to save the timer.
Click the timer to enter the running screen.
This part shows the remaining time, the remaining loop, and the button to tweak time.
This part shows the step list and highlights the current running step.
This is the control panel. They\'re Stop, Previous Step, Start/Pause, Next Step, and more options.
Click allows you to edit a reminder. For now, please finish the tutorial first
This starts a timer quickly. For now, click on the timer name to see its detail
You can try this after the tutorial
Without finishing the tutorial, the app may be confusing to use.
To go back to the previous step, click the Left Arrow at the bottom of the screen.
You can find the tutorial in \"Help & Feedback.\"
Some timers are stopped abnormally!\n\nIt is probably because the system kills the app in the background. To resolve this problem, please consider whitelisting this app in system settings.
Pausing on phone calls now requires \"Read phone status\" permission
Tasker support now requires \"Ignore Battery Optimization\" permission

Many Android manufacturers may kill running apps when the screen is off or switching to another app, which is an infamous Android problem.

This app tries its best to do its job well, but there's still a chance of failing.

Please whitelist this app in the system settings.
You can find Whitelist Guideline in \"Help & Feedback.\"

Most Android manufacturers shut down running background apps by force, making apps stops reminding you.

Please allow auto-start, allow background running, turn off battery optimization, etc., in the settings.

Here are some instructions:
A website that provides many solutions
Delete your account and all your backup data?\n\nThis does NOT affect your subscription. You can manage your subscription in the Google Play Store

"By tapping "Subscribe," your payment will be charged to your Google Play Store account. Your subscription will automatically renew for the same plan length at the same price until you cancel it on Subscriptions in the Google Play Store at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. By tapping "Subscribe," you agree to our %s and %s."
Subscriptions are not supported at the moment
There was an error connecting with Google Play.\n\nThis issue might be temporary, so please try again in a few minutes.
